description: Numbers n such that p(n)+50 is also prime, where p(k) is k-th prime.
comments: "Numerical evidence makes it plausible that there are infinitely many primes p such that p + 50 is also prime." - Burton, p. 52.
references: D. M. Burton, Elementary Number Theory, Allyn and Bacon, Inc., Boston, MA, 1976, pp. 52.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,1000
prog: (PARI) for(n=1,65, if(isprime(prime(n)+50),print(n)))(PARI) { n=m=0; forprime (p=2, 10^5, m++; if (isprime(p + 50), write("b062288.txt", n++, " ", m); if (n==1000, break)) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 04 2009]
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Jul 02 2001
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Jul 05 2001
